meanings.definition: Of or relating to a seta.
meanings.sent1: The setal structures on the insect's legs help it grip surfaces.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the setal properties of the plant's leaves.
meanings.sent3: The setal characteristics of the flower made it stand out in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her setal approach to problem-solving was methodical and precise.
meanings.sent5: The setal nature of the fabric gave it a unique texture.

meanings.sent1: The caterpillar had setal on its body for protection.
meanings.sent2: She brushed away the setal that clung to her sweater.
meanings.sent3: The setal on the brush made it perfect for grooming pets.
meanings.sent4: The setal of the porcupine served as a defense mechanism.
meanings.sent5: The setal of the broom helped sweep the floor efficiently.
